Issues.Title: test: use puppeteer in integration tests and to download correct chromedriver
Issues.Body:
This means integration tests no longer need to depend on a $CI_CHROMEDRIVER_VERSION_ARG environment variable to specify which chromedriver version to download to match the locally installed chrome. This was bad DX and not having it specified was not reliable as webdriver-manager would not always download the chromedriver version to work with the locally installed chrome.

`webdriver-manager update --gecko=false --standalone=false $CI_CHROMEDRIVER_VERSION_ARG` is now replaced with `node webdriver-manager-update.js` in the root package.json, which checks which version of chrome puppeteer has come bundled with & downloads informs webdriver-manager to download the corresponding chrome driver version.

Integration tests now use `"webdriver-manager": "file:../../node_modules/webdriver-manager"` and set resolution for it as well so they don't have to waste time calling webdriver-manager update in postinstall
```
"// resolutions": "Ensure a single version of webdriver-manager which comes from root node_modules that has already run webdriver-manager update",
"resolutions": {
"webdriver-manager": "file:../../node_modules/webdriver-manager"
}
```
This should speed up each integration postinstall by a few seconds.

Further, integration test package.json files link puppeteer via `file:../../node_modules/puppeteer` which is the ideal situation as the puppeteer post-install won't download chrome if it is already downloaded. In CI, since node_modules is cached it should not need to download Chrome either unless the node_modules cache is busted.

NB: each version of puppeteer comes bundles with a specific version of chrome. Root package.json & yarn.lock currently pull down puppeteer 2.1.0 which comes with chrome 80. See https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer#q-which-chromium-version-does-puppeteer-use for more info.

BONUS COMMIT: updated the aio build to use puppeteer as well so it no longer depends on CI_CHROMEDRIVER_VERSION_ARG.

Only two references to CI_CHROMEDRIVER_VERSION_ARG left:

1) `integration/bazel-schematics/test.sh` which I'm not entirely sure how to get rid of it <== @kyliau
2) `aio/tools/examples/shared/package.json` which I'm not hesitant to touch as its used for examples

Issues.Title: ControlValueAccessor and ExpressionChangedAfterItWasCheckedError
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package - @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I noticed that `registerOnChange` is called after `ngOnInit` by logging the registered function. My issue is that in `ngOnInit`, I set some things in my component and want to call the `onChange` function. So, I decided to use a `ReplaySubject(1)` to store emitted values. When an `onChange` function gets registered, I subscribe to the stream of values and emit a change on each value received. This causes Angular to throw `ExpressionChangedAfterItWasCheckedError`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - clone [this demo repo](https://github.com/gempain/angular-kxwkry) - `npm start` and open the console; you should see this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13135149/73408241-e128e680-42fb-11ea-9649-86329e23b588.png) The first two console logs show that `ngOnInit` is called before `registerOnChange`, so the first value emitted by the `my-control-sync` is not propagated to the parent. The second log shows the error, thrown after the on change function is called in `my-control-async`. ## üî• Exception or Error 

core.js:5809 ERROR Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: '{
  "sync": null,
  "async": null
}'. Current value: '{
  "sync": null,
  "async": "val"
}'.
    at throwErrorIfNoChangesMode (core.js:8009)
    at bindingUpdated (core.js:19509)
    at interpolation1 (core.js:19652)
    at Module.…µ…µtextInterpolate1 (core.js:23573)
    at AppComponent_Template (app.component.ts:7)
    at executeTemplate (core.js:11721)
    at refreshView (core.js:11568)
    at refreshComponent (core.js:13003)
    at refreshChildComponents (core.js:11298)
    at refreshView (core.js:11620)
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

@angular/* 9.0.0-rc.9

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): suggest, not error, on missing context members
Issues.Body: The language service reports an error when a directive's template context is missing a member that is being used in a template (e.g. if `$implicit` is being used with a template context typed as `any`). While this diagnostic message is valuable, typing template contexts loosely as `any` or `object` is very widespread in community packages, and often still compiles correctly, so reporting the diagnostic as an error may be misleading to users. This commit changes the diagnostic to be a warning, and adds additional information about how the user can eliminate the warning entirely -- by refining the template context type. A screenshot demonstrating the change with VSCode's LSP is attached to the PR for this commit. Closes https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/572 ## PR Checklist Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements: - [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit - [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) - [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [x] Bugfix - [x] Feature ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [ ] Yes - [x] No

Issues.Title: Create CI check to prevent additional typescript circular dependencies from being created
Issues.Body:
Create a CI check that uses madge to check circular dependencies between Typescript source files. 

We should have:
- [ ] A known list of circular deps to burn down
- [ ] Enforce ensure that we don't add new circular deps
- [ ] Provide a script for users to run, automatically updating the known circular deps list
- [ ] A code ownership group to specifically look at changes to the circular deps list
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Create CI check to prevent additional typescript circular dependencies from being created" (#35041)

Issues.Title: Styles from external components are included outside the scope of a shadow DOM component
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/platform-browser` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When deploying an Angular component with `encapsulation: ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom`, everything regarding the component should be kept inside the `#shadow-root`. This includes all stylings. #### Actual behavior 1. Styles added by `styleUrls` or `styles` in the `@Component` decorator are added to the `#shadow-root` ‚úîÔ∏è 2. Styles coming from external components like @angular/material are added to the `#shadow-root` ‚úîÔ∏è 3. Styles coming from external components are *also* added to document's `` outside of the `#shadow-root` ‚ùå #### Expected behavior Only 1. and 2. should happen. #### Root cause analysis As far as I can see, this is caused by the `ShadowDomRenderer` using the `DomSharedStylesHost` which adds `_doc.head` to its list of known `_hostNodes` in the constructor: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d43187f7ef7e841d84ecf594e8e515a9d534daaa/packages/platform-browser/src/dom/shared_styles_host.ts#L39 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-shadowdom-styles In the `` section there are `

Issues.Title: ci(docs-infra): ignore node version in `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job (for real)
Issues.Body:
In #35004, we started ignoring yarn's engines check for `yarn install` in AIO's `test-production.sh` script to fix a failure in the `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job. (See #35004 for details.)

It turns out that the version of yarn used on the stable branch (1.17.3) `--ignore-engines` is needed on all yarn commands (including `yarn run`). Thus, #35004 is not enough to fix the failures.
New example failure: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/604341

This commit turns of the engines check for the whole `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job to fix the failure and make the job more robust.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci(docs-infra): ignore node version in `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job (for real)" (#35033)

Issues.Title: Angular Animation, two :enter / :leave animations require extra css?
Issues.Body:
Hi,

**Goal**
I have a component that should animate two things:
 On Enter:
- Fade in,
- Slide-up a div

On Leave:
- Fade-out
- Slide-down the div

**Animation code**
```
    // the host / component should first fade in
    // we use HostBinding to bind this animation to the this (host) component
    trigger("fadeInState", [
      state("in", style({ opacity: 1 })),
      transition(":enter", [animate(".35s ease-out", style({ opacity: 1 }))]),
      transition(":leave", [animate(".35s ease-out", style({ opacity: 0 }))])
    ]),
    // in parallel, a div called '.activity' should animate 'up',
    // but its not animating, it just switches css classes, without transition...
    // >>> WHAT AM I DOING WRONG HERE ?
    trigger("slideUpState", [
      state("slide", style({ top: "20px" })),
      transition(":enter", [
        animate(".35s ease-in-out", style({ top: "20px" }))
      ]),
      transition(":leave", [animate(".35s ease-out", style({ top: "100vh" }))])
    ])
```

**Stackblitz**
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-kryqkn?file=src%2Fapp%2Fchild-view%2Fchild-view.component.ts

**The problem**

It seems the 2nd animation (slideUpState) is not tweening.. but it does switch states.

**workaround** 
I have added a extra css rule to the div (that should slide up) inside ```child-view.component.scss```
```
    transition: .2s ease-in-out all; // IT WORKS WITH TRANSTITON CSS RULE, but still weird
```

i find this very weird, because im using ```animate``` insde the ```transition``` triggers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Animation, two :enter / :leave animations require extra css?" (#35030)

Issues.Title: IVY: animation performance issues, on :enter trigger
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
probably one of these

`@angular/core`

### Is this a regression?

Yes it is much more fluent with less FPS drops during animations in version 8.

Issues.Title: Way to load additional css files with hash in filename after app init.
Issues.Body:
I am working on a good solution for dark / light theming depends on `prefers-color-scheme`. This is what i got: https://medium.com/@svenbudak/how-to-implement-dark-light-mode-in-angular-mateiral-with-prefers-color-scheme-ce3e980e2ea5

The problem in this solution is that both themes are includet inside the app. Which can be cool, because if there are just some some little lines they overwrite some basic colors, there will be no loading time while switching theme. But if there are some more lines of theming css, its overhead to load both.

So i added to angular.json:
```
"styles": [
    "src/scss/styles.scss",
    {
        "input": "src/scss/prefers-color-scheme/dark.scss",
        "bundleName": "dark"
    },
    {
        "input": "src/scss/prefers-color-scheme/light.scss",
        "bundleName": "light"
    }
]
```

Which is working very well. It generates me this 2 files:
```
dark.4dec7b0304c3dec40370.css
light.33e2a5c89c5f95e86528.css
```

I also asked in the `@angular/components` issue [board](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16905), but i think this is a angular task.

I know i can add in the angular.json the `inject` attribute, then they have no hashes and i can load them easy with renderer2. But then the PWA support will gets lost. They are any plans to make it possible to get somehow filenames like this after the app gets initialized? Because i need to check in app first the `prefers-color-scheme` (i will make this check in js file, because i do some more then only read it from browser).

Issues.Title: "validate-commit-message" lint check should only verify commits that belong to a given PR
Issues.Body: Currently the "validate-commit-message" lint check for PRs verify all commits from v9.0.x to HEAD (which is ~850 commits atm). Instead, the "validate-commit-message" lint check should only verify messages for commits that belong to a given PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""validate-commit-message" lint check should only verify commits that belong to a given PR " (#35021)

Issues.Title: Do not run "validate-commit-message" lint check for upstream branches
Issues.Body: Currently the `validate-commit-message` lint check is executed for PRs as well as upstream branches (master, 9.0.x, 8.2.x). There is no need to run this check for upstream branches, since all the necessary validation happens at PR stage. Note: all other lint checks (like formatting) should still be executed in upstream branches.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Do not run "validate-commit-message" lint check for upstream branches" (#35020)

Issues.Title: Schematics compliance with no-any lint rule
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command
- [x] lint

### Description

It's a very good practice in TypeScript to enable the `no-any` TSLint rule, which ensures that no `any` is used, as it's not type safe. Since [TypeScript 3.0](http://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-0.html#new-unknown-top-type), when a value type is really not known, the right type is `unknown`, which is type safe.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be nice if Angular CLI schematics could be compliant with that lint rule by default. It's currently not the case:
- in `test.ts` configuration files (application and library)
- in pipe schematic
- in e2e boilerplate

That would also be more consistent with other schematics where unknown values are indeed typed as `unknown` (like in the [interceptor schematic](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/interceptor/files/__name%40dasherize%40if-flat__/__name%40dasherize__.interceptor.ts.template)).

PR done in #16771. Note that it does not enable the lint rule, it just makes schematics compliant with it, so it has no consequences at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Schematics compliance with no-any lint rule" (#16770)

Issues.Title: clean previous ngcc ivy entrpoints works when running ng update
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] serve
- [x] update

### Description
Actually updating a project with `ng update` is not straightforward, if an update exist it update `package.json` versions and run `npm i` correctly. But now running `ng serve` always throw this known error:

> ERROR in The ngcc compiler has changed since the last ngcc build.
> Please remove "C:/Users/e.../ngcc-has-changed/node_modules" and try again.

Here we realize we need again remove `node_modules` and rerun `npm i`
This task  is long and not automatic, or something escapes me?

### Repro
Following my repro project which has fixed ng version to `9.0.0-rc.9`
1. run `git clone https://github.com/elvisbegovic/ngcc-has-changed.git && cd ngcc-has-changed && npm i && ng s`
2. kill `ng s` with Ctrl+C
3. run `ng update --next  @angular/cli @angular/core --allow-dirty && ng s`
4. error thrown



### Describe the solution you'd like
Clean previous ngcc ivy entrypoints works in `node_modules` during `ng update` command, so they could be again compiled when rerun `ng s` after update finish.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "clean previous ngcc ivy entrpoints works when running ng update" (#16791)

Issues.Title: Make the version strategy of caniuse-lite incremental
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

I manage so that browserslist doesn't have  `isEs5SupportNeeded` to trun off differential loading. But the result is not stable.

`caniuse-lite` has its own data in json file in npm package.  Both `build-angular` and `browserslist` have `caniuse-lite`.
Since dependencies of `browserslist` is incremental like `caniuse-lite "^1.0.30001017"` and `caniuse-lite` of `build-angular` is fixed, the judgment result of `BuildBrowserFeatures` can change even if the source code of the repository is the same.
Modern browsers are updated frequently, so Angular-cli may not be updated in time.

For example:

build-angular@0.803.23 includes "caniuse-lite": "1.0.30001019".
This version don't have the information of android chrome 79.
`last 2 versions` on the `browserslist` can return 79-78.
BuildBrowserFeatures.isFeatureSupported('es6-module') returns false, because featureStatus for android chrome 79 is undefined.

### Describe the solution you'd like

The package.json of `@angular-devkit/build-angular` changes version dependencies of `caniuse-lite` incrementally like "^1.0.0".

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Make the `caniuse-lite` included in the browserlist exactly match the` caniuse-lite` of the build-angular.

1. Point the version of `caniuse-lite` in resolutions.
2. Remove `caniuse-lite` in package.json, use dependiecies of package.json in browserlist.


It may be better to find the lowest supported version and judge the version with an inequality sign. If using `caniuse-api`, it can be easily. But impact on polyfill creation, etc. cannot be fully determined.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make the version strategy of caniuse-lite incremental" (#16790)

Issues.Body:

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>puppeteer/puppeteer</summary>

### [`v2.1.0`](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/releases/v2.1.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/compare/v2.0.0...v2.1.0)

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 80.0.3987.0 (r722234)
-   The launcher now has an option to run Puppeteer with different browsers, starting with Firefox ([#​5137](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/5137)). Puppeteer can now talk to a real, unpatched Firefox binary (as opposed to the old [Juggler](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/juggler)-based approach). This is a first step towards eventually deprecating the separate `puppeteer-firefox` package in favor of supporting Firefox directly in `puppeteer` itself.

Issues.Title: Something changed in fileReplacements and assets with Angular 9
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the pipeline to build/deploy was working in Angular 8.2, the behaviour changed migrating to Angular 9.rc10 ### Description The way that angular.json configuration for "fileReplacements" and "assets" works has changed. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction To deploy with CloudFoundry I need to provide an environment specific manifest.yml file. So I have a manifest.{env}.yml for each environment. In 8.2, I was specifying to replace the manifest file with "fileReplacements", and then adding the manifest.yml as an "asset" to push to CloudFoundry. For example for the environment "staging" I would have: /src/deployment/manifest.staging.yml /src/deployment/manifest.yml The first step here would be fileReplacements kicking in, moving the content from manifest.staging.yml inside manifest.yml The second/last step is manifest.yml being included in dist through the "assets" configuration, but with the staging's configuration inside. Instead, after migrating to Angular 9.rc10, fileReplacements doesn't happen in time and manifest.yml has the content of the original (non-staging) one. As a possible fix I tried this approach: I tried to change my assets configuration to grab directly the manifest file: { "glob": "manifest.staging.yml", "input": "apps/appointment-manager/src/deployment", "output": "manifest.yml" }, I expected: dist/manifest.yml Instead I got: dist/manifest.yml/manifest.staging.yml the output was read as a directory where to place the content. ## üî• Exception or Error Nope. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.10
Node: 12.4.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.0.0-rc.10
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

-----------------------------------------------------------

**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: Angular CLI component generations template for .spec.ts is missing an await
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?
No


### Description
Angular CLI component generations template for `.spec.ts` is missing an `await`.
The code generated looks like this:

```JavaScript
  beforeEach(async(() => {
    TestBed.configureTestingModule({
      declarations: [ MyComponent ]
    })
    .compileComponents();
  }));
```

The anonymous function was made `async` in this issue: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/4774

But just making the function `async` will not make it wait for the asynchronous call to `compileComponents()`.

The code should be changed to this (added `await`):
```JavaScript
  beforeEach(async(() => {
    await TestBed.configureTestingModule({
      declarations: [ MyComponent ]
    })
    .compileComponents();
  }));
```

Source code: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/component/files/__name%40dasherize%40if-flat__/__name%40dasherize__.__type%40dasherize__.spec.ts.template


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Simply generate a new component with tests:
```
ng generate component my-component
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular CLI component generations template for .spec.ts is missing an await" (#16767)

Issues.Title: ng add --registry not working
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [x] add - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Unsure, probably not. ### Description When trying to install a package with `ng add` from a local npm registry, using `ng add package-name --registry=http://localhost:4873/` (Verdaccio in my case), `ng add` seems to ignore the `--registry` parameter and continues to try and pull the package from the registry url set in npm config. If I set the npm registry to localhost manually, ng add works fine. `npm config set registry http://localhost:4873` Previous issue which asked for this feature: #14189. PR which supposedly added this feature: #14285. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Prerequisites: - Have Verdaccio or any other private / local npm registry running. - Have some package published in the private registry. Steps: 1. Generate new Angular project with `ng new`. 2. Run `ng add package-name --registry=http://localhost:4873`, replace package name and url with your own. 3. It will now throw an error because it can't find the package on `https://registry.npmjs.org/`, obviously. ## üî• Exception or Error

npm ERR! 404 You should bug the author to publish it (or use the name yourself!)

npm ERR! 404 tarball, folder, http url, or git url.

Issues.Title: fix(a11y): FocusMonitor.focusVia not handling null origin
Issues.Body: The `FocusMonitor.focusVia` method accepts a `FocusOrigin` which also allows for it to be `null` which indicates that the element was blurred. The way it's set up at the moment is that it sets null as the origin, but it still focuses the element which then sets it to `program`. While purely based on the naming passing in null doesn't make sense, the types aren't stopping users from passing it in and changing the type at this point would be a breaking change so these changes handle the null value.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(a11y): FocusMonitor.focusVia not handling null origin" (#18333)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): chip removal not working if animations are disabled
Issues.Body:
MDC waits for a `transitionend` event to fire before it emits the chip removal event, but if animations are disabled the event won't fire. These changes switch to using a very short transition instead.

**Note:** setting this to a P2, because it has a high probability of breaking people's tests.

Fixes #18303.

Issues.Title: Required asterisk of form field labels are wrongly colored in accent color
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Required asterisk of form field labels are colored in **primary** (as in the color that is used to color the label) color.

#### What is the current behavior?
Required asterisk of form field labels are colored in **accent** color.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-svwsjn (fork of [offical template](https://stackblitz.com/angular/qxnldxyaday) with `required` set on the input component)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Fulfilling the (current) material design spec.

> If required text is colored, that color should also be used for the asterisk  

Taken from http://material.io/components/text-fields/#anatomy in the section _Label text > Required text indicator_  at `Wed, 29 Jan 2020 9:54:57 GMT`, see screenshot for reference.

![Workspace 1_446](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16593597/73348473-c1f17100-4289-11ea-9289-cf8c48e2c82d.png)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All permutations of every variable listed should be affected.

Confirmed with
**Angular**: 7.55
**Material**: 8.2.0; 8.2.3
**OS**: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
**Typescript**: 3.5.3
**Browsers**: Chrome Version 79.0.3945.88 (Official Build) (64-bit)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This has been this way since 2016, since the initial commit of the (then) responsible file for theming the asterisk: https://github.com/angular/components/commit/e0726e15bf0fd1696e9bcb53f8d75d25ca815689

I suspect the material design spec was different back then.

This has been reported in a smaller scope previously, but not yet been fixed: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16826
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Required asterisk of form field labels are wrongly colored in accent color " (#18326)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): mark control as touched once panel is closed
Issues.Body:
Currently we mark the autocomplete control as touched on `blur`. The problem is that the `blur` event happens a split second before the panel is closed which can cause the error styling to show up and disappear quickly which looks glitchy. These changes change it so that the control is marked as touched once the panel is closed.

Also makes a couple of underscored properties private since they weren't used anywhere in the view.

Fixes #18313.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): mark control as touched once panel is closed" (#18318)

Issues.Title: Drag and drop - Preview swaping items instead of moving
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

Swap items in preview mode instead of moving them.

I got it working on the drop method by using this code
```
 drop(event: CdkDragDrop<string[]>) {
    const temp = this.items[event.currentIndex];
    this.items[event.currentIndex] = this.items[event.previousIndex];
    this.items[event.previousIndex] = temp;
  }
```

But the preview does not work like that, instead it moves the items to the initial dragged item position.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I tried disabling sorting, but when I do that, the drop event always set `event.currentIndex` equal to `event.previousIndex`.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Stackblitz: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-15vjqk](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-15vjqk)

Move items around.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8.1.1
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System): Windows 10 Pro X64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag and drop - Preview swaping items instead of moving" (#18317)

Issues.Title: Option to have no tab selected in mat-tab-group
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Allow MatTabGroup to have a state where no tab is selected/active. The current behavior always has a tab selected/active.

Currently, MatTabGroup has a selectedIndex property with type number | null, but setting it to null does not unselect any of the tabs; the first tab is selected/active by default. I think that it would be more intuitive if setting selectedIndex to null unselected all of the tabs.

#### Use Case

Adding this feature would allow for a tab group to be in a collapsed state where no tab is selected and only the header is visible. Clicking one of the tabs in the header would then set the selected tab, the current behavior. This would provide more flexibility in using tabs for a layout.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Option to have no tab selected in mat-tab-group" (#18316)

Issues.Title: Table with paginator, ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenChecked when restoring page index
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction My case is a quite straightforward search result display with paginator. When I navigate away from the search result route from the first result page and come back to it, everything works fine. When I navigate away from another page (index > 0) and come back to it, an `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` error is raised. Reproduction link : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-okcqx3 Steps to reproduce: 1. Clic on "item11" or "item22" link, then "back to table". No error is raised 2. Navigate to page 2 or 3 and clic any link ("item33" for instance), then "back to table". Error is raised. Detailed messages (two different errors are raised) : - `Previous value: 'disabled: true'. Current value: 'disabled: false'` - `Previous value: 'null: undefined'. Current value: 'null: 33'` I know the conditions which can lead to `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` but could not identify any here. I could narrow the condition for the second error : `{{item.name}}` However, I do not understand why my code would trigger a change during the two detection cycles. I cannot figure out why the `*ngIf` at this line of the template would be interpreted once as undefined, then as 33. The id of the item is always present in this 33 item. The name of the property (`null`) is also quite strange. #### Expected Behavior No error raised in browser console. #### Actual Behavior An `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` Error is raised. Note : This behavior is present only during development phase as the check is removed as expected by the `--prod` compilation. I did NOT see any production problem related to it. However, due to a general ErrorHandler in the application (which is catching all the frontend errors for proper display), the `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` is rather annoying as it triggers this general handler. #### Environment - Angular: 8.2.14 - CDK/Material: 8.2.3 - Browser(s): Tested on Chrome and Firefox - Operating System : Win 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Table with paginator, ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenChecked when restoring page index" (#18311)
